us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.tools

Class EuclidGeometryPolygonTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.tools.EuclidGeometryPolygonTools

  • public class EuclidGeometryPolygonTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a variety of tools to perform operations with polygons.

    • Method Detail

      • isPolygon2DConvexAtVertex

        public static boolean isPolygon2DConvexAtVertex(int vertexIndex,
                                                java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices,
                                                boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Tests if the polygon defined by the given vertices is convex at the vertex defined by the given vertexIndex.

        Edge cases:

        • the method returns false if the vertex, next and previous vertices lie on the same line.
        • the method returns false if the polygon has less than 3 vertices.

        Parameters:
        vertexIndex - the index of the vertex to be tested for convexity.
        vertices - the list of vertices defining the polygon to test. Not modified.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        true if the polygon is convex at the given vertex, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if vertexIndex is either negative or greater or equal than numberOfVertices.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • isPolygon2DConvexAtVertex

        public static boolean isPolygon2DConvexAtVertex(int vertexIndex,
                                                java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices,
                                                int numberOfVertices,
                                                boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Tests if the polygon defined by the given vertices is convex at the vertex defined by the given vertexIndex.

        Edge cases:

        • the method returns false if the vertex, next and previous vertices lie on the same line.
        • the method returns false if the polygon has less than 3 vertices.

        Parameters:
        vertexIndex - the index of the vertex to be tested for convexity.
        vertices - the list of vertices defining the polygon to test. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices relevant to the polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        true if the polygon is convex at the given vertex, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if vertexIndex is either negative or greater or equal than numberOfVertices.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if vertexIndex is either negative or greater or equal than numberOfVertices.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • inPlaceGiftWrapConvexHull2D

        public static int inPlaceGiftWrapConvexHull2D(java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices)
        In-place and garbage free implementation of the Gift wrapping algorithm for computing the convex hull 2D of a set of points.

        The given list vertices is reordered such that the vertices of the clockwise convex hull are positioned first. The method returns the number of vertices that compose the convex hull.

        Parameters:
        vertices - the 2D point cloud from which the convex hull is to be computed. Modified.
        Returns:
        the size of the convex hull.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • inPlaceGiftWrapConvexHull2D

        public static int inPlaceGiftWrapConvexHull2D(java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices,
                                              int numberOfVertices)
        In-place and garbage free implementation of the Gift wrapping algorithm for computing the convex hull 2D of a set of points.

        The given list vertices is reordered such that the vertices of the clockwise convex hull are positioned first. The method returns the number of vertices that compose the convex hull.

        Parameters:
        vertices - the 2D point cloud from which the convex hull is to be computed. Modified.
        numberOfVertices - specifies the number of relevant points in the list. The algorithm will only process the points ∈ [0; numberOfVertices[.
        Returns:
        the size of the convex hull.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • inPlaceGrahamScanConvexHull2D

        public static int inPlaceGrahamScanConvexHull2D(java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices)
        In-place and garbage free implementation of the Graham scan algorithm for computing the convex hull 2D of a set of points.

        The given list vertices is reordered such that the vertices of the clockwise convex hull are positioned first. The method returns the number of vertices that compose the convex hull.

        Parameters:
        vertices - the 2D point cloud from which the convex hull is to be computed. Modified.
        Returns:
        the size of the convex hull.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • inPlaceGrahamScanConvexHull2D

        public static int inPlaceGrahamScanConvexHull2D(java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> vertices,
                                                int numberOfVertices)
        In-place and garbage free implementation of the Graham scan algorithm for computing the convex hull 2D of a set of points.

        The given list vertices is reordered such that the vertices of the clockwise convex hull are positioned first. The method returns the number of vertices that compose the convex hull.

        Parameters:
        vertices - the 2D point cloud from which the convex hull is to be computed. Modified.
        numberOfVertices - specifies the number of relevant points in the list. The algorithm will only process the points ∈ [0; numberOfVertices[.
        Returns:
        the size of the convex hull.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • computeConvexPolyong2DArea

        public static double computeConvexPolyong2DArea(java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                int numberOfVertices,
                                                boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics centroidToPack)
        Computes the area and centroid (optional) of a convex polygon defined by its size numberOfVertices and vertices convexPolygon2D.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • if numberOfVertices == 0, this method returns Double.NaN and centroidToPack is set to Double.NaN.
        • if numberOfVertices < 3, this method returns 0.0 and centroidToPack is set to average of the polygon vertices.

        Parameters:
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        centroidToPack - point 2D in which the centroid of the convex polygon is stored. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the area of the convex polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • edgeNormal

        public static boolean edgeNormal(int edgeIndex,
                                 java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                 int numberOfVertices,
                                 boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DBasics normalToPack)
        Computes the vector that points to the outside and orthogonal to the edgeIndexth edge of the given convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Parameters:
        edgeIndex - index of the vertex the edge starts from.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        normalToPack - the vector that is orthogonal to the edge and points toward the outside of the polygon. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the method succeeds or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if edgeIndex is either negative or greater or equal than numberOfVertices.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • isPoint2DInsideConvexPolygon2D

        public static boolean isPoint2DInsideConvexPolygon2D(double pointX,
                                                     double pointY,
                                                     java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                     int numberOfVertices,
                                                     boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                     double epsilon)
        Determines if the point is inside the convex polygon given the tolerance epsilon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        It is equivalent to performing the test against the polygon shrunk by Math.abs(epsilon) if epsilon < 0.0, or against the polygon enlarged by epsilon if epsilon > 0.0.

        Edge cases:

        • if numberOfVertices == 0, this method returns false.
        • if numberOfVertices == 1, this method returns false if epsilon < 0 or if the query is at a distance from the polygon's only vertex that is greater than epsilon, returns true otherwise.
        • if numberOfVertices == 2, this method returns false if epsilon < 0 or if the query is at a distance from the polygon's only edge that is greater than epsilon, returns true otherwise.
        Parameters:
        pointX - the x-coordinate of the query.
        pointY - the y-coordinate of the query.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use during the test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the polygon, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • isPoint2DInsideConvexPolygon2D

        public static boolean isPoint2DInsideConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                                                     java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                     int numberOfVertices,
                                                     boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                     double epsilon)
        Determines if the point is inside the convex polygon given the tolerance epsilon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        It is equivalent to performing the test against the polygon shrunk by Math.abs(epsilon) if epsilon < 0.0, or against the polygon enlarged by epsilon if epsilon > 0.0.

        Edge cases:

        • if numberOfVertices == 0, this method returns false.
        • if numberOfVertices == 1, this method returns false if epsilon < 0 or if the query is at a distance from the polygon's only vertex that is greater than epsilon, returns true otherwise.
        • if numberOfVertices == 2, this method returns false if epsilon < 0 or if the query is at a distance from the polygon's only edge that is greater than epsilon, returns true otherwise.
        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use during the test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the polygon, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • intersectionBetweenLine2DAndConvexPolygon2D

        public static int intersectionBetweenLine2DAndConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                                              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly lineDirection,
                                                              java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                              int numberOfVertices,
                                                              boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                                              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line 2D and a given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns 0 and the two intersection-to-pack arguments remain unmodified.
        • If there is only one intersection, this method returns 1 and the coordinates of the only intersection are stored in firstIntersectionToPack. secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point located on the line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the direction of the line. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • intersectionBetweenLine2DAndConvexPolygon2D

        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line 2D and a given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        • If no intersections exist, this method returns 0 and the two intersection-to-pack arguments remain unmodified.
        • If there is only one intersection, this method returns 1 and the coordinates of the only intersection are stored in firstIntersectionToPack. secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLineX - the x-coordinate of a point on the line.
        pointOnLineY - the y-coordinate of a point on the line.
        lineDirectionX - the x-component of the direction of the line.
        lineDirectionY - the y-component of the direction of the line.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

                                                                                           us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly lineDirection,

                                                                                           boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line 2D and a given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections and returns null.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point located on the line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the direction of the line. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the intersections between between the line and the polygon or null if the method failed or if there is no intersections.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • intersectionBetweenLineSegment2DAndConvexPolygon2D

        public static int intersectionBetweenLineSegment2DAndConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentStart,
                                                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentEnd,
                                                                     java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                                     int numberOfVertices,
                                                                     boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line segment 2D and a given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns 0 and the two intersection-to-pack arguments remain unmodified.
        • If there is only one intersection, this method returns 1 and the coordinates of the only intersection are stored in firstIntersectionToPack. secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.
        • If the line segment is collinear to an edge:
          • The edge entirely contains the line segment: this method finds two intersections which are the endpoints of the line segment.
          • The line segment entirely contains the edge: this method finds two intersections which are the vertices of the edge.
          • The edge and the line segment partially overlap: this method finds two intersections which the polygon's vertex that on the line segment and the line segment's endpoint that is on the polygon's edge.

        Parameters:
        lineSegmentStart - the first endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        lineSegmentEnd - the second endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection between the line segment and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection between the line segment and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line segment and the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • intersectionBetweenLineSegment2DAndConvexPolygon2D

        public static us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.Point2D[] intersectionBetweenLineSegment2DAndConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentStart,
                                                                                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentEnd,
                                                                                                  java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                                                                  int numberOfVertices,
                                                                                                  boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line segment 2D and a given convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections and this method returns null.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns null.
        • If the line segment is collinear to an edge:
          • The edge entirely contains the line segment: this method finds two intersections which are the endpoints of the line segment.
          • The line segment entirely contains the edge: this method finds two intersections which are the vertices of the edge.
          • The edge and the line segment partially overlap: this method finds two intersections which the polygon's vertex that on the line segment and the line segment's endpoint that is on the polygon's edge.

        Parameters:
        lineSegmentStart - the first endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        lineSegmentEnd - the second endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the intersections between the line segment and the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • signedDistanceFromPoint2DToConvexPolygon2D

        public static double signedDistanceFromPoint2DToConvexPolygon2D(double pointX,
                                                                double pointY,
                                                                java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                                int numberOfVertices,
                                                                boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Returns minimum distance between the point and the polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        The return value is negative if the point is inside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns Double.NaN.
        • If the polygon has exactly one vertex, the returned value is positive and is equal to the distance between the query and the polygon's vertex.
        • If the polygon has exactly two vertices, the returned value is positive and is equal to the distance and the line segment defined by the polygon's two vertices.

        Parameters:
        pointX - the x-coordinate of the query.
        pointY - the y-coordinate of the query.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the distance between the query and the polygon, it is negative if the point is inside the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • signedDistanceFromPoint2DToConvexPolygon2D

        public static double signedDistanceFromPoint2DToConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                                                                java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                                int numberOfVertices,
                                                                boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Returns minimum distance between the point and the polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        The return value is negative if the point is inside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns Double.NaN.
        • If the polygon has exactly one vertex, the returned value is positive and is equal to the distance between the query and the polygon's vertex.
        • If the polygon has exactly two vertices, the returned value is positive and is equal to the distance and the line segment defined by the polygon's two vertices.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the distance between the query and the polygon, it is negative if the point is inside the polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • closestPointToNonInterectingRay2D

        public static boolean closestPointToNonInterectingRay2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly rayOrigin,
                                                        us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly rayDirection,
                                                        java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                        int numberOfVertices,
                                                        boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                        us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics closestPointToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the closest point to the ray that belongs to the given convex polygon.

        WARNINGS:

        • This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.
        • This methods assumes that the ray does not intersect with the polygon. Such scenario should be handled with intersectionBetweenRay2DAndConvexPolygon2D(Point2DReadOnly, Vector2DReadOnly, List, int, boolean, Point2DBasics, Point2DBasics).

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns false.
        • If the ray is parallel to the closest edge, the closest point to the ray origin is chosen.

        Parameters:
        rayOrigin - the ray's origin. Not modified.
        rayDirection - the ray's direction. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        closestPointToPack - the point in which the coordinates of the closest point are stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the method succeeds, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • closestPointToNonInterectingRay2D

        public static us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.Point2D closestPointToNonInterectingRay2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly rayOrigin,
                                                                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly rayDirection,
                                                                               java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                                               int numberOfVertices,
                                                                               boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Computes the coordinates of the closest point to the ray that belongs to the given convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNINGS:

        • This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.
        • This methods assumes that the ray does not intersect with the polygon. Such scenario should be handled with intersectionBetweenRay2DAndConvexPolygon2D(Point2DReadOnly, Vector2DReadOnly, List, int, boolean, Point2DBasics, Point2DBasics).

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • If the ray is parallel to the closest edge, the closest point to the ray origin is chosen.

        Parameters:
        rayOrigin - the ray's origin. Not modified.
        rayDirection - the ray's direction. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the closest point to the ray or null if the method failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • closestVertexIndexToPoint2D

        public static int closestVertexIndexToPoint2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly point,
                                              java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                              int numberOfVertices)
        Finds the index of the closest vertex to the query.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns -1.

        Parameters:
        point - the coordinates of the query. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        Returns:
        the index of the closest vertex to the query.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • lineOfSightStartIndex

        public static int lineOfSightStartIndex(double observerX,
                                        double observerY,
                                        java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                        int numberOfVertices,
                                        boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        From the point of view of an observer located outside the polygon, only a continuous subset of the polygon's edges can be seen defining a line-of-sight. This method finds the index of the first vertex that is in the line-of-sight.

        WARNING:

        • This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.
        • This method assumes that the given observer is located outside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • The polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns -1.
        • The observer is inside the polygon, this method fails and returns -1.
        • The polygon has exactly one vertex, this method returns 0 if the observer is different from the polygon's vertex, or returns -1 if the observer is equal to the polygon's vertex.

        Parameters:
        observerX - the x-coordinate of the observer.
        observerY - the y-coordinate of the observer.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        the index of the first vertex that is in the line-of-sight, -1 if this method fails.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • lineOfSightIndices

        public static int[] lineOfSightIndices(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly observer,
                                       java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                       int numberOfVertices,
                                       boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        From the point of view of an observer located outside the polygon, only a continuous subset of the polygon's edges can be seen defining a line-of-sight. This method finds the indices of the first vertex and last vertex that are in the line-of-sight.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING:

        • This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.
        • This method assumes that the given observer is located outside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • The polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • The observer is inside the polygon, this method fails and returns null.
        • The polygon has exactly one vertex, this method returns new int[]{0, 0} if the observer is different from the polygon's vertex, or returns null if the observer is equal to the polygon's vertex.

        Parameters:
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        in order the index of the first vertex and the index of the last vertex that are in the line-of-sight, null if this method fails.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • nextEdgeIndexIntersectingWithLine2D

        public static int nextEdgeIndexIntersectingWithLine2D(int previousEdgeIndex,
                                                      us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                                      us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly lineDirection,
                                                      java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                      int numberOfVertices)
        Finds the index of the next polygon's edge that the given line intersects.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        The exploration starts with the edge at the index previousEdgeIndex + 1.

        Edge cases:

        • If previousEdgeIndex == -2, this method automatically fails and returns -2.
        • If the polygon has less than 2 vertices, this method fails and returns -2.
        • If the line and an edge of the polygon are collinear and the polygon has exactly 2 vertices, this method fails and returns -2.
        • If the polygon has exactly 2 vertices and the line intersects it, this method returns previousEdgeIndex + 1.
        • If the line and an edge of the polygon are collinear and the polygon has more than 2 vertices, this method returns the index of the previous edge or the next edge if the given previousEdgeIndex refers to the previous edge.
        • If the line is going through a vertex, this method considers that the line intersects with the two adjacent edges.

        Parameters:
        previousEdgeIndex - refers to the index of the previously found edge intersecting with the line. To find the first intersecting edge, it should be set to -1.
        pointOnLine - a point located on the line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the direction of the line. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        Returns:
        the index of the next polygon's edge the line intersects with, if none found -2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if previousEdgeIndex is not in [-2, numberOfVertices[.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • nextEdgeIndexIntersectingWithLine2D

        public static int nextEdgeIndexIntersectingWithLine2D(int previousEdgeIndex,
                                                      double pointOnLineX,
                                                      double pointOnLineY,
                                                      double lineDirectionX,
                                                      double lineDirectionY,
                                                      java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                      int numberOfVertices)
        Finds the index of the next polygon's edge that the given line intersects.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        The exploration starts with the edge at the index previousEdgeIndex + 1.

        Edge cases:

        • If previousEdgeIndex == -2, this method automatically fails and returns -2.
        • If the polygon has less than 2 vertices, this method fails and returns -2.
        • If the line and an edge of the polygon are collinear and the polygon has exactly 2 vertices, this method fails and returns -2.
        • If the polygon has exactly 2 vertices and the line intersects it, this method returns previousEdgeIndex + 1.
        • If the line and an edge of the polygon are collinear and the polygon has more than 2 vertices, this method returns the index of the previous edge or the next edge if the given previousEdgeIndex refers to the previous edge.
        • If the line is going through a vertex, this method considers that the line intersects with the two adjacent edges.

        Parameters:
        previousEdgeIndex - refers to the index of the previously found edge intersecting with the line. To find the first intersecting edge, it should be set to -1.
        pointOnLineX - the x-coordinate of a point located on the line.
        pointOnLineY - the y-coordinate of a point located on the line.
        lineDirectionX - the x-component of the direction of the line.
        lineDirectionY - the y-component of the direction of the line.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        Returns:
        the index of the next polygon's edge the line intersects with, if none found -2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if previousEdgeIndex is not in [-2, numberOfVertices[.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • orthogonalProjectionOnConvexPolygon2D

        public static boolean orthogonalProjectionOnConvexPolygon2D(double pointToProjectX,
                                                            double pointToProjectY,
                                                            java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                                            int numberOfVertices,
                                                            boolean clockwiseOrdered,
                                                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics projectionToPack)
        Computes the orthogonal projection of a 2D point on a given 2D convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns false.
        • If the polygon has exactly one vertex, the result is the polygon only vertex, this method returns true.

        Parameters:
        pointToProjectX - the x-coordinate of the point to compute the projection of.
        pointToProjectY - the y-coordinate of the point to compute the projection of.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        projectionToPack - point in which the projection of the point onto the convex polygon is stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the method succeeded or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • orthogonalProjectionOnConvexPolygon2D

        public static boolean orthogonalProjectionOnConvexPolygon2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointToProject,
                                                            java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,

        Computes the orthogonal projection of a 2D point on a given 2D convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns false.
        • If the polygon has exactly one vertex, the result is the polygon only vertex, this method returns true.
        • If the query is inside the polygon, the method fails and returns false.

        Parameters:

        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.

        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        projectionToPack - point in which the projection of the point onto the convex polygon is stored. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the method succeeded or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • canObserverSeeEdge

        public static boolean canObserverSeeEdge(int edgeIndex,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly observer,
                                         java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> convexPolygon2D,
                                         int numberOfVertices,
                                         boolean clockwiseOrdered)
        Determines whether an observer can see the outside of the given edge of the given convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given vertices already form a convex polygon.

        The edge is defined by its start convexPolygon2D.get(edgeIndex) and its end convexPolygon2D.get(edgeIndex + 1).

        Parameters:
        edgeIndex - the vertex index of the start of the edge.
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        convexPolygon2D - the list containing in [0, numberOfVertices[ the vertices of the convex polygon. Not modified.
        numberOfVertices - the number of vertices that belong to the convex polygon.
        clockwiseOrdered - whether the vertices are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Returns:
        true if the observer can see the outside of the edge, false if the observer cannot see the outside or is lying on the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if edgeIndex is either negative or greater or equal than numberOfVertices.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfVertices is negative or greater than the size of the given list of vertices.

      • findVertexIndex

        public static int findVertexIndex(Vertex2DSupplier vertex2DSupplier,
                                  boolean isXPriority,
                                  EuclidGeometryPolygonTools.Bound xBound,
                                  EuclidGeometryPolygonTools.Bound yBound)
        Finds the index of a vertex in the specified supplier given search criteria.
        Parameters:
        vertex2DSupplier - the vertex supplier containing vertices to be search through.
        isXPriority - whether the search should focus first on finding the vertex with the "best" x-coordinate, or y-coordinates.
        xBound - the search criterion for the x-coordinate, for instance EuclidGeometryPolygonTools.Bound.MAX while result in searching the vertex with the lowest x value.
        yBound - the search criterion for the Y-coordinate, for instance EuclidGeometryPolygonTools.Bound.MIN while result in searching the vertex with the highest y value.
        Returns:
        the index in the supplier of the best vertex according to the given criteria.

      • wrap

        public static int wrap(int index,
                       int listSize)
        Recomputes the given index such that it is ∈ [0, listSize[.

        The index remains unchanged if already ∈ [0, listSize[.

        Examples:

        • wrap(-1, 10) returns 9.
        • wrap(10, 10) returns 0.
        • wrap( 5, 10) returns 5.
        • wrap(15, 10) returns 5.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to be wrapped if necessary.
        listSize - the size of the list around which the index is to be wrapped.
        Returns:
        the wrapped index.

      • next

        public static int next(int index,
                       int listSize)
        Increments then recomputes the given index such that it is ∈ [0, listSize[. Examples:
        • next(-1, 10) returns 0.
        • next(10, 10) returns 1.
        • next( 5, 10) returns 6.
        • next(15, 10) returns 6.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to be incremented and wrapped if necessary.
        listSize - the size of the list around which the index is to be wrapped.
        Returns:
        the wrapped incremented index.

      • previous

        public static int previous(int index,
                           int listSize)
        Decrements then recomputes the given index such that it is ∈ [0, listSize[. Examples:
        • next(-1, 10) returns 10.
        • next(10, 10) returns 9.
        • next( 5, 10) returns 4.
        • next(15, 10) returns 4.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to be decremented and wrapped if necessary.
        listSize - the size of the list around which the index is to be wrapped.
        Returns:
        the wrapped decremented index.
